answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I have found some resources on the Knowledge Network which may help answer your question.
This is a copy of Sarasota County, Florida’s economic stimulus program. It includes efforts they have taken to create more jobs.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/3492/Sarasota_Countys_Economic_Stimulus_Program
Alexandria, Minnesota has developed a similar document which discusses their job creation practices.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/301239/2009_Alexandria_MN_Area_Economic_Development_Commission_Report
Developing ties with businesses has also been a popular way to help develop jobs. You can see an example of local governments working entrepreneurs for job growth below.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/5090/CommunityBased_Entrepreneurship_Development
Novi, Michigan was recently recognized for being a leader in entrepreneurial development. You can see an article about that below.
http://icma.org/en/Article/100745/Novi_MI_Recognized_for_Fostering_Entrepreneurial_Growth
Also, in Manassas, Virginia they hosted a private-public job fair to spread awareness of job opportunities in their area.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/9037/PublicPrivate_Partnership_Coordinates_Job_Fair
New environmentally conscience innovations and technologies have also been a popular starting point for many municipalities when it comes to new jobs. Green projects are a great way to create jobs while improving your community.
You can see more information about this movement in the document below about transferring blue collar jobs to “green collar jobs.”
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/4403/Blue_Collar_Green_Collar
Also, you can read more about the 2010 ICMA Community Sustainability Award Nominee, San Jose, California for their Green Vision and Strategic Energy Plan which incorporated job growth.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/302339/2010_ICMA_Community_Sustainability_Award_Nominee_Green_Vision_and_Strategic_Energy_Plan
Some areas have also begun to develop incentive programs to create jobs.
Manatee County, FL: http://icma.org/en/Article/100561/Manatee_County_FL_Incentive_Program_Aims_to_Create_Jobs
New Marana, AZ: 
http://icma.org/en/Article/100510/New_Marana_AZ_Incentive_Programs_aim_to_Create_Jobs
Finally, you can read about the benefits of taping into the creative arts for expanding the economy and creating jobs.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/4971/Harnessing_the_Power_of_the_Arts_Capitalizing_on_the_Economic_Power_of_the_Creative_Industry
I hope these help!
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Tracy Miller
text:
Has your community been able to generate an increase in new jobs?  If yes, what is your government entities participation in the effort(s)?  Can you describe what activities have taken place?  
Please respond here or directly to tmiller@transformgov.org.  
Tracy Miller  
Florida Regional Director  
Alliance for Innovation
title: Generating Jobs in Your Community
